III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI licensing Rule: R 400.4158 Intervention standards and
Section prohibitions. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and
Description follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the following
forms of intervention: (iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion,
1

punishment, or otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm
to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation About a week and a half ago, a supervisor went to their car and
cocked a gun several times in front of a youth and stated that they
were calling their killer up to the facility who was waiting down the
block.
Investigation On 11/16/2023 an in-person interview was held with the Vice
President of Residential Services (VPR) and the Chief
Administrator (CA) at Wolverine Center. VPR indicated he was
aware of the allegations as he had been contacted by staff
regarding the allegations and instructed staff to make call to
DHHS to report the concerns. VPR advised that Staff 3 had
reported the alleged incident to supervision on 11/6/23. He
reported that Youth A initially stated that it occurred on 11/5/23 or
11/6/23 and identified Supervisor 1 as the staff that threatened
him with the firearm. VPR added that the youth had indicated a
variety of different variations of this same allegation. Both VPR
and CA indicated that they believed that Supervisor 1 was not
even working the night that the incident was alleged to have
occurred. VPR was asked about Staff 1, and he advised that Staff
1 was no longer employed with the agency. VPR stated that Staff
1 was placed on leave on 11/10/2023 and was subsequently
terminated on 11/15/2023. VPR further indicated that Staff 1 was
upset with the agency because of the termination, and he believed
that the employee called DHHS with false allegations.
On 11/16/2023 an in-person interview was held with Youth A at
Wolverine Center. Youth A declined to discuss the allegations
and stated that he did not report these allegations to anyone.
Attempts to engage Youth A in conversation regarding the alleged
incident resulted in him again stating that he did not want to talk
about it and that he was “pleading the fifth”. Youth A confirmed
that he feels safe in his placement.
On 11/16/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Capstone Academy. Staff 2 was familiar with the alleged incident
and indicated it was alleged to have occurred on 11/5/23. He
recalled he was not with the youth at the time, but that the youth
reported it to him the next day. He stated Youth A told him
Supervisor 1 pulled a gun on him. Youth A reported that he did
not see the gun, but heard it being cocked repeatedly. Staff 2
reported that he did not recall Youth A saying anything about
being threatened or the son of Supervisor 1 being at the agency.
Staff 2 reported that after speaking to the youth, he notified his
2

supervisor of the allegations. Staff 2 confirmed that an incident
report was completed. Staff 2 denied knowledge of Supervisor 1
or any other staff using weapons to threaten youth.
On 11/17/2023 a telephone call was held with complainant. No
additional concerns were noted.
On 11/17/2023 a telephone call was held with Staff 1. He
reported that he debriefed with Staff 3 on the night that the alleged
incident occurred, and Staff 3 stated Youth A said he was
threatened by Supervisor 1 with a gun. Staff 1 denied that he
completed an incident report or called the alleged abuse or
neglect to DHHS as he thought the other staff had. He stated
Supervisor 1 worked midnight shift. Staff 1 denied knowledge of
the alleged date. Staff 1 reported that he believed Youth A to be
assigned one on one staffing during this time but is not aware who
that staff would have been. Staff 1 denied direct knowledge of
Supervisor 1 being rude to the youth or using any type of weapon
or firearm to threaten youth.
On 12/01/2023 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
Wolverine Center. He reported that he doesn’t recall, but believes
that he was providing one-on-one staffing for Youth A. The
supervisor on duty was called on the night of 11/6/23 and advised
of the concerns. Staff 3 reported that call was made to DHHS the
early morning of 11/7/23. Staff 3 denied that Youth A disclosed
anything to him regarding a gun or any other weapon.
On 12/01/2023 and in person interview was held with Staff 4 at
Wolverine Center. Staff 4 stated he does not recall, but believes
he was the one-on-one staff assigned to Youth A. He thought the
incident possibly happened on 11/3/23 or 11/4/23 and was
reported to him on 11/5/23 or 11/6/23. Staff 4 recalled that Youth
A stated that it occurred at the side door and that it happened two
times. He recalled that Youth A would be outside a lot, even after
it got dark around 6pm. He stated the youth would just walk
outside and staff would follow and monitor for appropriate
actions. Staff 4 believed that Supervisor 1 was off on 11/4/23 and
11/5/23. Staff 4 further reported that Youth A would identify
different staff daily as his “target” staff. He denied seeing or
hearing a staff use a firearm. Staff 4 denied any knowledge of
Supervisor 1 being inappropriate with youth at the facility.
On 12/01/2023 in-person interviews were had with Youth B and
Youth C at Wolverine Center. Both youth denied ever seeing a
gun at the agency and specifically denied seeing Supervisor 1
3

with a gun on the premises. Both youth reported feeling safe at
the agency and spoke about Supervisor 1 in a positive manner.
On 12/18/2023 a telephone interview was completed with
Supervisor 1. She confirmed that she works midnight shift but
could not recall if she worked on 11/4/23 -11/7/23. She confirmed
that her normal off days are Sunday and Monday, however she
reported that she has been picking up days due to staff
shortages. Supervisor 1 denied that she owns a gun and denied
that she threatened Youth A with a gun. Supervisor 1 confirmed
that she has a son that is in high school, but denied that she
threatened to bring her son to Wolverine Center as a threat to
Youth A.
Video review:
On 12/01/2023 a review of camera footage for 11/5/23 and
11/6/23 during the hours of 10pm and 8am. There was no
significant activity that was seen during this time.
Documents reviewed:
An incident report dated 11/7/2023 was reviewed. It indicated that
Youth A had reported that Supervisor 1 had threatened him with a
gun and that Youth A reported hearing the sound of the gun
repeatedly cocking. It was noted that the incident report was not
signed by the staff that submitted it. It was submitted by Staff 2.
An email from the assigned foster care specialist for Youth A was
also reviewed. It was dated 11/20/2023 and was addressed to
VPR. The email indicated that Youth A stated he “never reported
those allegations and stated that did not happen”.
On 11/16/2023 a review of the HR file of Supervisor 1 occurred.
Supervisor 1 has been employed with the agency since 1/23/23.
She works midnights shift, which is from 10:30pm to 7:00am.
There was one coaching incident in the HR file dated 4/7/23
relative to attendance. No additional disciplinary action was
documented.
Timecards of Supervisor 1 was reviewed. It documented that she
worked the following days:
11/3 7:15pm to 9:00 am
11/4 Off
11/5 Off
11/6 Off
11/7 3pm to 8:15am
4

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was not sufficient
evidence to support violation of licensing rule R4158. Supervisor
1 was interviewed and denied the allegations. She specifically
stated she does not own a firearm and would never bring one on
the property of Wolverine. Youth A was interviewed and declined
to discuss the allegations. He also advised the assigned worker
that he never reported these allegations and that it “did not
happen”.
Conclusion No Violations Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
